alert.note: Alert for Northern Franklin; Southeastern St. Lawrence; Southern Franklin; Western Clinton; Western Essex (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: High Wind Warning issued January 08 at 3:36PM EST until January 10 at 7:00AM EST by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...HIGH WIND WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 4 PM TUESDAY TO 7 AM EST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Southeast winds 25 to 35 mph with gusts up to 65 mph expected. * WHERE...The northern Adirondacks of New York, Champlain Valley of Vermont, and western slope of the Green Mountains. * WHEN...From 4 PM Tuesday to 7 AM EST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Damaging winds will blow down trees and power lines. Widespread power outages are expected. Travel will be difficult, especially for high profile vehicles. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...A period of heavy wet snowfall is expected Tuesday afternoon and evening outside of the Champlain Valley. This snow may cling to trees and power lines and increase the likelihood of power outages.
info.instruction: People should avoid being outside in forested areas and around trees and branches. If possible, remain in the lower levels of your home during the windstorm, and avoid windows. Use caution if you must drive.

area.areaDesc: Northern Franklin; Southeastern St. Lawrence; Southern Franklin; Western Clinton; Western Essex
